intro: Coccoloba euvelutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruits are three-lobed berries that contain several seeds. Coccoloba euvelutina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
